prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions are approximately 2:1:1. Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.2008, 0.0]. Creating the Sketch On this coordinate system, create a new sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. **Face 1:** 1. Draw the first loop (loop_1) with 4 lines: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.372] - line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.372], End Point [0.0, 0.372] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.372], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw the second loop (loop_2) with 4 lines: - line_1: Start Point [0.0201, 0.0201], End Point [0.7299, 0.0201] - line_2: Start Point [0.7299, 0.0201], End Point [0.7299, 0.352] - line_3: Start Point [0.7299, 0.352], End Point [0.0201, 0.352] - line_4: Start Point [0.0201, 0.352], End Point [0.0201, 0.0201] **Face 2:** 3. Draw the loop (loop_1) with 4 lines that are identical to the lines in Face 1, loop_1. Creating the Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the direction of the normal by 0.0236 units; maintain its depth by not extruding in the opposite direction. The sketch scale will be 0.75. This operation results in the creation of a new solid body. Part 2 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top and bottom. Creating the Coordinate System Reuse the same coordinate system as for Part 1. Creating the Sketch For Part 2, you will reuse the sketch from Part 1. Creating the Extrusion Perform an extrusion by setting extrude_depth_towards_normal to 0.2008 units, while keeping the depth at 0 for the opposite direction. Maintain a sketch scale of 0.75. This will result in a join operation with the preceding CAD models. With the provided CAD Assembly JSON, you have now constructed a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side, centered on the x-axis and slightly offset from the y-axis, with an approximate 2:1:1 dimension ratio. This includes two successive parts with an "Approximately 3:1:1" shape.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part of the CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following properties: * Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.6683, 0.0, 0.0 2. **Draw the first face of the sketch** on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. This face will be a rectangle with two parallel lines and two arcs creating a chamfered corner. 3. **Create the first loop** of the face with the following curves: * Line 1: Start Point (0.0223, 0.0), End Point (0.7277, 0.0) * Arc 1: Start Point (0.7277, 0.0), Mid Point (0.75, 0.0223), End Point (0.7277, 0.0446) * Line 2: Start Point (0.7277, 0.0446), End Point (0.0223, 0.0446) * Arc 2: Start Point (0.0223, 0.0446), Mid Point (0.0, 0.0223), End Point (0.0223, 0.0) 4. **Create the second loop** of the face with the following curves: * Line 1: Start Point (0.0223, 0.0037), End Point (0.7277, 0.0037) * Arc 1: Start Point (0.7277, 0.0037), Mid Point (0.7463, 0.0223), End Point (0.7277, 0.0408) * Line 2: Start Point (0.7277, 0.0408), End Point (0.0223, 0.0408) * Arc 2: Start Point (0.0223, 0.0408), Mid Point (0.0037, 0.0223), End Point (0.0223, 0.0037) 5. **Scale the 2D sketch** using the sketch scale of 0.75 6. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. **Extrude the 3D sketch** along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.6683 towards the normal and 0 opposite the normal to create the 3D model. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, with a length, width, and height of 0.6683, 0.75, and 0.75 units, respectively.</description>
